result.execSummary:
The defendant Asabi C Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2; with credit for 5 days time served

Defendant to report to probation and provide DNA sample by 07-18-2022
Defendant can complete probation early at the discretion of the agent

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample; Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees. Pay all supervision fees, court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA surcharge during period of probation. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

- NO CONTACT with victim I.Z.J. except as authorized by CHIPS and DMCPS.
- NO CORPORAL PUNISHMENT of any kind.
- NO CONTACT with firearms.

- Any programming completed with CHIPS to apply.
- A course in Anger Management.
- Parenting Classes.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Cooperate with CHIPS and DMCPS.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1; with credit for 5 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Asabi C Johnson

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, filed.

Defendant Asabi C Johnson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Arraignment held.  Original amended information has been e-filed; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading and pleads not guilty subject to the Court accepting change of plea today. Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2.  

Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Parenting Class Certificate of Completion, filed.

Defendant Asabi C Johnson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Stip Order Videotaped, signed and filed.

Defendant Asabi C Johnson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 35.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, CPAU No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with IZJ (08/13/2014) and ZJJ (08/24/2013)

Defendant Asabi C Johnson in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Asabi C Johnson in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Asabi C Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
